intro: Triglochin triandra, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to wetland and marshy environments in Europe and parts of Asia. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of white or greenish flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and colonize moist soils effectively. Triglochin triandra is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic ecosystems.
